meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of anagoge.
meanings.sent1: The anagogical interpretation of the story revealed its deeper spiritual meaning.
meanings.sent2: The anagogical significance of the ancient text was not immediately apparent.
meanings.sent3: The anagogical twist at the end of the movie left the audience in awe.
meanings.sent4: Her anagogical approach to problem-solving helped her see beyond the surface.
meanings.sent5: The anagogical nature of the painting evoked a sense of wonder and mystery.

meanings.sent1: The anagogical teachings of the philosopher focused on spiritual enlightenment.
meanings.sent2: The anagogical symbolism in the poem added depth to its meaning.
meanings.sent3: The anagogical reference in the play made the audience ponder its hidden message.
meanings.sent4: His anagogical perspective allowed him to see the world in a new light.
meanings.sent5: The anagogical elements in the music created a sense of transcendence.

meanings.sent1: The anagogical journey in the novel symbolized personal growth and transformation.
meanings.sent2: The anagogical nature of the ritual connected the participants to a higher spiritual realm.
meanings.sent3: The anagogical twist in the plot caught the readers by surprise.
meanings.sent4: Her anagogical insights into human behavior were both enlightening and profound.
meanings.sent5: The anagogical experience of meditation brought inner peace and clarity.
